cards.title: Is it a hug? Is it a kiss? / How (not) to avoid awkwardness when greeting human beings
cards.rawTitle: How (not) to avoid awkwardness when greeting human beings

item.title: Cartoon: a non-guide to avoid awkwardness when greeting human beings by Sarah Glidden
item.trailText: Is it a hug? Is it a kiss? Cartoonist Sarah Glidden had to navigate the confusing world of greetings many times during her travels – and there’s just no way to avoid feeling embarrassed
item.standFirst: Is it a hug? Is it a kiss? Cartoonist Sarah Glidden had to navigate the confusing world of greetings many times during her travels – and there’s just no way to avoid feeling embarrassed

cards.title: Mythbusting / African people don't want your stinky T-shirts
cards.rawTitle: African people don't want your stinky T-shirts

item.title: African people don't want your stinky T-shirts, and other mythbusters
item.trailText: Eliza Anyangwe argues that myths created by the western media are being dispelled slowly by Africans telling their own stories online
item.standFirst: When you hear the word 'Africa', what comes to mind? It's likely you think of death, destruction and disease (and maybe safari.) Western media has had a single story of the continent for centuries. But, argues Eliza Anyangwe, African people are slowly dispelling the myths by telling their own stories online
item.byline: Eliza Anyangwe, Maya Wolfe-Robinson, Leah Green, Bruno Rinvolucri, Caterina Monzani

cards.title: Telly Addict / Mad Men, 1864, Grayson Perry's Dream House
cards.rawTitle: Mad Men, 1864, Grayson Perry's Dream House

item.title: Mad Men, 1864, Grayson Perry's Dream House and more: TV review
item.trailText: Telly addict Andrew Collins enters Grayson Perry's Dream House on C4, and likes what they've done to the place
item.standFirst: This week, telly addict Andrew Collins avoids spoiling the final episode of Mad Men; wishes he'd read the novel before attempting fantasy Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell on BBC1; gets wrapped up in year-specific Danish historical drama 1864; enters Grayson Perry's Dream House on C4, and likes what they've done to the place; and binges on all three grippingly grim episodes of cop doc The Detectives on BBC2

cards.title: One city, two centuries / Rio then and now

item.title: One city, two centuries: Rio then and now – in pictures
item.trailText: A new book brings Marc Ferrez’s vivid 19th-century photographs of Rio together with Robert Polidori’s modern shots to show the Marvellous City in all its chaos and beauty
item.standFirst: Cobbled streets, elegant parks and deserted beaches – the Rio de Janeiro of 1890 was a far cry from the colourful, cluttered city of today. A new book, published by Steidl, brings together the poetic black-and-white shots of 19th-century Brazilian photographer Marc Ferrez with the wild, chaotic photos of present day Rio by Robert Polidori, and show a city transformed with time

displayImages.caption: View from Cais Pharoux (Pharoux Quay), circa 1875. Castle Hill and the Sugarloaf Mountain are in the background Photograph: Marc Ferrez

Rio by Marc Ferrez and Robert Polidori published by Steidl.

cards.title: 'It's in our blood' / Training with Armenia's wrestlers

item.title: 'It's in our blood': training with Armenia's wrestlers
item.trailText: In the snow-covered spa town of Tsaghkadzor a new generation of fighters are schooled in the country’s most popular sport. Brownbook went to meet them
item.standFirst: In the snow-covered spa town of Tsaghkadzor a new generation of fighters are schooled in the country’s most popular sport. Brownbook went to meet them
item.byline: Natasha Stallard and Nazik Armenakyan for Brownbook

displayImages.caption:
The Armenian Wrestling Federation retreat to the spa town of Tsaghkadzor each year for an intensive two-week training session in a snow-covered Olympic sports complex
Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Armenian Wrestling Federation retreat to the spa town of Tsaghkadzor each year for an intensive two-week training session in a snow-covered Olympic sports complex

displayImages.caption: For Armenians, wrestling is in the blood. Alongside chess and boxing, it’s the country’s most popular sport Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: For Armenians, wrestling is in the blood. Alongside chess and boxing, it’s the country’s most popular sport

displayImages.caption: The sports centre was built by the USSR to prepare Soviet athletes for the 1968 Olympics in Mexico, due to the similar altitude between Tsaghkadzor and Mexico City. It’s still one of the most sophisticated sports facilities in the Caucasus Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: The sports centre was built by the USSR to prepare Soviet athletes for the 1968 Olympics in Mexico, due to the similar altitude between Tsaghkadzor and Mexico City. It’s still one of the most sophisticated sports facilities in the Caucasus

displayImages.caption: The Federation has produced a number of European and world champions, and gold medallists, who typically begin wrestling at aged 10, if not younger Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Federation has produced a number of European and world champions, and gold medallists, who typically begin wrestling at aged 10, if not younger

displayImages.caption: Training begins at 8am, with a 45-minute warm-up in the snow, followed by breakfast (‘nothing fried’), team sports and two hours of wrestling in the evenings Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: Training begins at 8am, with a 45-minute warm-up in the snow, followed by breakfast (‘nothing fried’), team sports and two hours of wrestling in the evenings

displayImages.caption: A silver medallist at the 1994 European Wrestling Championships, Arayik Baghdadyan is now chief coach, and remains as passionate about the sport as ever Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: A silver medallist at the 1994 European Wrestling Championships, Arayik Baghdadyan is now chief coach, and remains as passionate about the sport as ever

displayImages.caption: ‘I’ve spent my whole life in this sport – it’s a lovely way to live,’ Baghdadyan says. ‘You need a lot of passion, but you also need to be a good psychologist. I work with the wrestlers on a personal level – I understand each of them as individuals’ Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: ‘I’ve spent my whole life in this sport – it’s a lovely way to live,’ Baghdadyan says. ‘You need a lot of passion, but you also need to be a good psychologist. I work with the wrestlers on a personal level – I understand each of them as individuals’

displayImages.caption: ‘The space, the air – everything is here,’ says Armen Malkhasyan, another of the full-time coaches. ‘We don’t have time for other work’  Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: ‘The space, the air – everything is here,’ says Armen Malkhasyan, another of the full-time coaches. ‘We don’t have time for other work’

displayImages.caption: ‘For Armenians it’s important to have healthy and strong sons,’ says retired wrestler Samvel Manukyan, who prescribes wrestling as the solution to most problems Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption: ‘For Armenians it’s important to have healthy and strong sons,’ says retired wrestler Samvel Manukyan, who prescribes wrestling as the solution to most problems

displayImages.caption:
‘If they are strong enough, they can overcome any issue in their life… in the street, in the army, anything,’ says Manukyan.

All images by Nazik Armenakyan.

This gallery originally appeared in Brownbook, part of the Guardian world networks Photograph: Brownbook
displayImages.cleanCaption:
‘If they are strong enough, they can overcome any issue in their life… in the street, in the army, anything,’ says Manukyan.

All images by Nazik Armenakyan.

This gallery originally appeared in Brownbook, part of the Guardian world networks

cards.title: Little penguins from Australia settle into New York home
cards.rawTitle: Little penguins from Australia settle into New York home

item.title: Little penguins from Australia settle into New York home
item.trailText: A group of little penguins, also known as blue penguins, make their first public appearance at New York's Bronx Zoo
item.standFirst: A group of little penguins, also known as blue penguins, make their first public appearance at New York's Bronx Zoo, after being transferred from Sydney. There are conservation programs for the endangered species in their natural Australian habitat but this group were brought to New York as part of a breeding program. They reach about 13 inches (33 cm) in height and weigh an average of two to three pounds (900 grams to 1.5kg)

stillImage.caption: Little penguins from Taronga Zoo in Sydney settle into their new Bronx Zoo home. 20 May 2015 Photograph: Wildlife Conservation Society Photograph: Wildlife Conservation Society
stillImage.cleanCaption: Little penguins from Taronga Zoo in Sydney settle into their new Bronx Zoo home. 20 May 2015 Photograph: Wildlife Conservation Society

displayImages.caption: Little penguins from Taronga Zoo in Sydney settle into their new Bronx Zoo home. 20 May 2015 Photograph: Wildlife Conservation Society Photograph: Wildlife Conservation Society
displayImages.cleanCaption: Little penguins from Taronga Zoo in Sydney settle into their new Bronx Zoo home. 20 May 2015 Photograph: Wildlife Conservation Society

cards.title: Fee Fi Fo Fum! / How to draw a giant

item.title: How to draw … a giant
item.trailText: Fee Fi Fo Fum! Find out how to draw the Giant of Jum, in this scary lesson by Benji Davies
item.standFirst: Fee Fi Fo Fum! Find out how to draw the Giant of Jum, in this scary lesson by Benji Davies

displayImages.caption: The Giant of Jum is grumpy and hungry and he’s off in search of a tasty snack. And the tastiest of all is a boy known as Jack! So why don’t you learn how to draw him before he turns on you! Benji Davies shows you how! Photograph: Illustration: Benji Davies
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Giant of Jum is grumpy and hungry and he’s off in search of a tasty snack. And the tastiest of all is a boy known as Jack! So why don’t you learn how to draw him before he turns on you! Benji Davies shows you how!
